title: PostgreSQL AS

metadata.description: Learn about PostgreSQL AS with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Aliases
SQL aliases are used to give a table, or a column in a table, a temporary name.
Aliases are often used to make column names more readable.
An alias only exists for the duration of that query.
An alias is created with the
AS
keyword.
Example
Using aliases for columns:
SELECT customer_id AS id
FROM customers;
Run Example »
AS is Optional
Actually, you can skip the
AS
keyword and get the same result:
Example
Same result without
AS
:
SELECT customer_id id
FROM customers;
Run Example »
Concatenate Columns
The
AS
keyword is often used when two or more fields are concatenated into one.
To concatenate two fields use
||
.
Example
Concatenate two fields and call them
product
:
SELECT product_name 
        || unit AS product
FROM products;
Run Example »
Note:
In the result of the example above we are missing a space between
product_name and unit. To add a space when concatenating, use
|| ' ' ||
.
Example
Concatenate, with space:
SELECT product_name || ' ' || unit AS product
FROM products;
Run Example »
Using Aliases With a Space Character
If you want your alias to contain one or more spaces, like "
My Great Products
", surround your alias with double quotes.
Example
Surround your alias with double quotes:
SELECT product_name AS "My Great Products"
FROM products;
Run Example »

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT customer_id AS id
FROM customers;

content_sections.title: Example
Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT product_name || ' ' || unit AS product
FROM products;

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT product_name AS "My Great Products"
FROM products;

What is PostgreSQL AS

The correct definition of PostgreSQL AS

Aliases

quiz.question: What is Aliases?
options: often used to make column names more readable
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Aliases is 'often used to make column names more readable'.

summary: This tutorial covers PostgreSQL AS concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PostgreSQL AS effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PostgreSQL AS and how to apply it in your projects.
